name: Antonio Creus
introduction: Antonio Creus y Rubn de Celis (born October 28th 1924 in Madrid, Spain; died February 19th 1996 in Madrid) was a Spanish racing driver and competitive motoryclist who competed in the 1960 Argentine Grand Prix as a privateer.  Driving a Maserati 250F, Creus qualified 22nd and last, and retired on lap 16 due to exhaustion and electrical problems.
